entityId.localType: Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office Series Number

nameEntry.part: Personal Files of Children who Lived at the Home

biogHist.abstract: The Personal Files of Children who Lived at the Home contain the correspondence, school results, and photographs of children living in the Northern Tasmanian Home for Boys, later known as Glenara. The photographs mainly belong to the 1970s and 1980s. Child, Youth and Family Services were told that staff at the home destroyed earlier files.
biogHist.p:
Closed D75 years
D75 means these records are closed to the general public for 75 years from the date of the last entry in them. People wishing to access these records should contact Children and Youth Services, which is run by the Department of Health and Human Services. How access is provided once permission is granted will depend on the file. Usually Children and Youth Services request it and then provide access or copies. Staff at the Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office may be able to assist you in finding other relevant records.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office Records (1965 - )
Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office - Contact Details

descriptiveNote.p: The Northern Tasmanian Home for Boys created these files.
Glenara, as the successor to the Northern Tasmanian Home for Boys, created these files.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Personal Files of Children who Lived at the Home', in Find & Connect - Tasmania,
